sens.mc: a dwelling place of perfect happiness for the soul after death
sens.vi: prayed that the souls of the deceased would go to heaven
sens.syn: above, bliss, elysian fields, Elysium, empyrean, kingdom come, New Jerusalem, paradise, sky, Zion (also Sion)
sens.rel: Beulah, glory, happy hunting ground, nirvana, promised land, Valhalla; afterlife, afterworld, hereafter, otherworld
sens.near: inferno; limbo, purgatory; hades, netherworld, underworld; abyss, pit

sens.mc: an often imaginary place or state of utter perfection and happiness
sens.vi: compared to my old job, this new one is heaven
sens.syn: Camelot, Cockaigne, Eden, Elysium, empyrean, fantasyland, heaven, lotusland, never-never land, New Jerusalem, nirvana, promised land, Shangri-la, utopia, Zion (also Sion)
sens.rel: arcadia; dreamland, dreamworld, fairyland, wonderland; blessedness, bliss, blissfulness, euphoria, gladness, joy

sens.mc: a state of overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion
sens.vi: she was in heaven the day she learned she was one of the finalists for the science scholarship
sens.syn: cloud nine, elatedness, elation, euphoria, exhilaration, heaven, high, intoxication, paradise, rapture, rhapsody, seventh heaven, swoon, transport
sens.rel: exaltation; blessedness, bliss, blissfulness, delight, enchantment, felicity, gladness, happiness, joy, joyfulness, joyousness, pleasure; reverie, trance; inspiration; fervor, frenzy, madness, passion; cheer, cheerfulness, exuberance, gaiety (also gayety), glee, gleefulness, jubilance, jubilation, lightheartedness
sens.near: misery, sadness, unhappiness, woe, wretchedness; blues, dejection, desolation, despair, despondency, disconsolateness, disheartenment, dispiritedness, doldrums, downheartedness, dreariness, dumps, forlornness, gloom, gloominess, heartsickness, melancholy, mopes

sens.mc: the expanse of air surrounding the earth
sens.vi: the space shuttle gradually disappeared into the heavens

sens.mc: coming or happening by good luck especially unexpectedly
sens.vi: a heaven-sent offer to be the all-expenses-paid chaperone to some students on a trip to Paris
sens.syn: fluky (also flukey), fortuitous, happy, heaven-sent, lucky, providential
sens.rel: convenient, opportune, seasonable, timely; unexpected, unforeseen, unlooked-for; accidental, chance, coincidental, serendipitous; auspicious, bright, encouraging, fair, heartening, hopeful, promising, propitious; benign, favorable, golden, good, halcyon; advantageous, beneficial, profitable
sens.near: inconvenient, inopportune, unseasonable, untimely; anticipated, expected, foreseen; deliberate, intentional, planned; inauspicious, unpromising; calamitous, catastrophic, disastrous
sens.ant: hapless, ill-fated, ill-starred, luckless, star-crossed, unfortunate, unhappy, unlucky

sens.mc: a situation or state of carefree comfort
sens.vi: a drink was in my hand, my butt was in a hot tub, and I was in hog heaven
sens.syn: easy street, fun and games, hog heaven, picnic
sens.rel: primrose path; heaven, paradise, utopia; American dream, good life; ease, relaxation, rest
sens.near: agony, hell, horror, misery, murder, nightmare, torment, torture

sens.mc: a state of overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion
sens.vi: she was in seventh heaven when she received the acceptance letter to medical school
sens.syn: cloud nine, elatedness, elation, euphoria, exhilaration, heaven, high, intoxication, paradise, rapture, rhapsody, seventh heaven, swoon, transport
sens.rel: exaltation; blessedness, bliss, blissfulness, delight, enchantment, felicity, gladness, happiness, joy, joyfulness, joyousness, pleasure; reverie, trance; inspiration; fervor, frenzy, madness, passion; cheer, cheerfulness, exuberance, gaiety (also gayety), glee, gleefulness, jubilance, jubilation, lightheartedness
sens.near: misery, sadness, unhappiness, woe, wretchedness; blues, dejection, desolation, despair, despondency, disconsolateness, disheartenment, dispiritedness, doldrums, downheartedness, dreariness, dumps, forlornness, gloom, gloominess, heartsickness, melancholy, mopes
